member.name: T:Box.V2.Auth.AuthRepository
member.summary: Default auth repository implementation that will manage the life cycle of the authentication tokens. This class can be extended to provide your own token management implementation by overriding the virtual methods

member.summary: Fires when the authentication session is invalidated

member.summary: Fires when a new set of auth token and refresh token pair has been fetched

member.summary: Instantiates a new AuthRepository.

How requests/responses will be serialized/deserialized respectively.

member.summary: Instantiates a new AuthRepository

member.name: P:Box.V2.Auth.AuthRepository.Session
member.summary: The current session of the Box Client

member.name: M:Box.V2.Auth.AuthRepository.AuthenticateAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Authenticates the session by exchanging the provided auth code for a Access/Refresh token pair
member.param: Authorization Code. The authorization code is only valid for 30 seconds.
member.returns: The session of the Box Client after authentification

member.name: M:Box.V2.Auth.AuthRepository.RefreshAccessTokenAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Refreshes the session by exchanging the access token for a new Access/Refresh token pair. In general, this method should not need to be called explicitly, as an automatic refresh is invoked when the SDK detects that the tokens have expired.
member.param: The access token to refresh.
member.returns: Refreshed session of Box Client.

member.name: M:Box.V2.Auth.AuthRepository.LogoutAsync
member.summary: Logs the current session out by invalidating the current Access/Refresh tokens

member.name: M:Box.V2.Auth.AuthRepository.ExchangeAuthCode(System.String)
member.summary: Performs the authentication request using the provided auth code
member.param: Authorization Code. The authorization code is only valid for 30 seconds.
member.returns: The current session after exchanging Authorization Code

member.name: M:Box.V2.Auth.AuthRepository.ExchangeRefreshToken(System.String)
member.summary: Performs the refresh request using the provided refresh token
member.param: Refresh token used to exchange for a new access token. Each refresh_token is valid for one use in 60 days. Every time you get a new access_token by using a refresh_token, we reset your timer for the 60 day period and hand you a new refresh_token
member.returns: Refreshed Box Client session

member.name: M:Box.V2.Auth.AuthRepository.InvalidateTokens(System.String)
member.summary: Performs the revoke request using the provided access token. This will invalidate both the access and refresh tokens
member.param: The access token to invalidate

member.name: M:Box.V2.Auth.AuthRepository.OnSessionInvalidated
member.summary: Allows sub classes to invoke the SessionInvalidated event

member.name: M:Box.V2.Auth.AuthRepository.OnSessionAuthenticated(Box.V2.Auth.OAuthSession)
member.summary: Allows sub classes to invoke the SessionAuthenticated event.
member.param: Authenticated session.

member.summary: The active OAuth2 session

member.name: E:Box.V2.Auth.IAuthRepository.SessionInvalidated
member.summary: Event for when the session is no longer valid and a new set of Access/Refresh tokens are required

member.name: E:Box.V2.Auth.IAuthRepository.SessionAuthenticated
member.summary: Fires when a new set of auth token and refresh token pair has been fetched

member.name: M:Box.V2.Auth.IAuthRepository.AuthenticateAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Performs the 2nd step of the OAuth2 workflow and exchanges the auth code for an Access and Refresh token
member.param: The auth code received from step 1 of the OAuth2 workflow
member.returns: A fully authenticated OAuth2 session

member.summary: Exchanges an expired access token for a renewed one using the current refresh token

member.name: M:Box.V2.Auth.IAuthRepository.LogoutAsync
member.summary: Revokes access by invalidating both the access token and refresh token

member.name: T:Box.V2.BoxClient
member.summary: The central entrypoint for all SDK interaction. The BoxClient houses all of the API endpoints and are represented as resource managers for each distinct endpoint

member.name: M:Box.V2.BoxClient.#ctor(Box.V2.Config.IBoxConfig,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Instantiates a BoxClient with the provided config object
member.param: The config object to be used
The user ID to set as the 'As-User' header parameter; used to make calls in the context of a user using an admin token

Whether or not to suppress both email and webhook notifications. Typically used for administrative API calls. Your application must have “Manage an Enterprise” scope, and the user making the API calls is a co-admin with the correct "Edit settings for your company" permission.

member.name: M:Box.V2.BoxClient.#ctor(Box.V2.Config.IBoxConfig,Box.V2.Auth.OAuthSession,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Instantiates a BoxClient with the provided config object and auth session
member.param: The config object to be used
A fully authenticated auth session
The user ID to set as the 'As-User' header parameter; used to make calls in the context of a user using an admin token

Whether or not to suppress both email and webhook notifications. Typically used for administrative API calls. Your application must have “Manage an Enterprise” scope, and the user making the API calls is a co-admin with the correct "Edit settings for your company" permission.

member.param: The config object to be used
An IAuthRepository that knows how to retrieve new tokens using JWT
The user ID to set as the 'As-User' header parameter; used to make calls in the context of a user using an admin token

Whether or not to suppress both email and webhook notifications. Typically used for administrative API calls. Your application must have “Manage an Enterprise” scope, and the user making the API calls is a co-admin with the correct "Edit settings for your company" permission.

member.name: T:Box.V2.JWTAuth.BoxJWTAuth
member.summary: Box’s new authentication model allows applications to authenticate directly to Box using a JSON Web Token (JWT) signed with an RSA key. This authentication method is meant for server-to-server applications and replaces the first leg of the standard 3-legged OAuth 2.0 process in which users grant an application authorization to access their Box account.

Box service is used to perform GetToken requests

member.summary: Used to add a collaboration for a single user or a single group to a folder or file. Either an email address, a user ID, or a group id can be used to create the collaboration. If the collaboration is being created with a group, access to this endpoint is granted based on the group's invitability_level.
member.param: BoxCollaborationRequest object.
Attribute(s) to include in the response.
Determines if the user, (or all the users in the group) should receive email notification of the collaboration.
member.returns: The new collaboration object is returned. Errors may occur if the IDs are invalid or if the user does not have permissions to create a collaboration.

member.summary: Used to edit an existing collaboration. Descriptions of the various roles can be found here
member.param: BoxCollaborationRequest object.
Attribute(s) to include in the response.
member.returns: The updated collaboration object is returned. If the role is changed to owner, the collaboration is deleted with a new one created for the previous owner and a 204 is returned. Errors may occur if the IDs are invalid or if the user does not have permissions to edit the collaboration.

member.name: M:Box.V2.Managers.BoxCollectionsManager.GetCollectionItemsAsync(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the files and/or folders contained within this collection. Collection item lists behave a lot like getting a folder’s items.
member.param: The collection identifier.
The maximum number of items to return in a page.

The offset at which to begin the response. An offset of value of 0 will start at the beginning of the folder-listing. Offset of 2 would start at the 2nd record, not the second page. Note: If there are hidden items in your previous response, your next offset should be = offset + limit, not the # of records you received back.
Attribute(s) to include in the response.
Whether or not to auto-paginate to fetch all items; defaults to false.

member.summary: The manager that represents the events endpoint

member.name: M:Box.V2.Managers.BoxEventsManager.EnterpriseEventsAsync(System.Int32,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset},System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset})
member.summary: Retrieves up to a year's events for all users in the enterprise. High latency. You must be using a token that is scoped to admin level in order to use this endpoint.
member.param: Limits the number of events returned (defaults to 500).

The starting position for fetching the events. This is used in combination with the limit to determine which events to return to the caller. Use the results from the next_stream_position of your last call to get the next set of events.
Events to filter by.
A lower bound on the timestamp of the events returned.
An upper bound on the timestamp of the events returned.

member.name: M:Box.V2.Managers.BoxEventsManager.UserEventsAsync(System.Int32,Box.V2.Models.UserEventsStreamType,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Use this to get events for a given user.
member.param: Limits the number of events returned (defaults to 500).

Restricts the types of events returned: all returns all events; changes returns events that may cause file tree changes such as file updates or collaborations; sync returns events that may cause file tree changes only for synced folders.
The location in the event stream from which you want to start receiving events. You can specify the special value 'now' to get 0 events and the latest stream_position value. Defaults to 'now'.
Whether or not to automatically de-duplicate events as they are received. Defaults to true.

member.name: M:Box.V2.Managers.BoxEventsManager.LongPollUserEvents(System.String,System.Action{Box.V2.Models.BoxEventCollection{Box.V2.Models.BoxEnterpriseEvent}},System.Threading.CancellationToken,Box.V2.Models.UserEventsStreamType,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Used to get real-time notification of activity in a Box account.
member.param: The location in the event stream from which you want to start receiving events.
Method to invoke when new events are received.
Used to request that the long polling process terminate.

Restricts the types of events returned: all returns all events; changes returns events that may cause file tree changes such as file updates or collaborations; sync returns events that may cause file tree changes only for synced folders.
Whether or not to automatically de-duplicate events as they are received. Defaults to true.
Used to override the retry timeout value returned from the long polling OPTIONS request.

The starting position for fetching the events. This is used in combination with the limit to determine which events to return to the caller. Use the results from the next_stream_position of your last call to get the next set of events.
Events to filter by.

member.name: M:Box.V2.Managers.BoxFilesManager.UploadNewVersionAsync(System.String,System.String,System.IO.Stream,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Byte[],System.Boolean,System.Uri,System.Nullable{System.DateTimeOffset})
member.summary: This method is used to upload a new version of an existing file in a user’s account. Similar to regular file uploads, these are performed as multipart form uploads. An optional If-Match header can be included to ensure that client only overwrites the file if it knows about the latest version. The filename on Box will remain the same as the previous version. To update the file’s name, you can specify a new name for the file using the fileName parameter. A proper timeout should be provided for large uploads.
member.param: Name of the file.
Id of the file to upload a new version to.
Stream of the uploading file.
This ‘etag’ field of the file, which will be set in the If-Match header.
Fields which shall be returned in result.
Optional timeout for response.
The SHA1 hash of the file.
Set position for input stream to 0.
Optional url for uploading file.
member.returns: A full file object is returned.

member.name: M:Box.V2.Managers.BoxFilesManager.PromoteVersionAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: If there are previous versions of this file, this method can be used to promote one of the older versions to the top of the stack. This actually mints a copy of the old version and puts it on the top of the versions stack. The file will have the exact same contents, the same SHA1/etag, and the same name as the promoted version. Other properties such as comments do not get updated to their former values.
member.param: Id of the file (Required).
Id of the version (Required).
member.returns: The newly promoted file_version object is returned

member.name: M:Box.V2.Managers.BoxFoldersManager.GetFolderItemsAsync(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean,System.String,System.Nullable{Box.V2.Models.BoxSortDirection},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the files and/or folders contained within this folder without any other metadata about the folder. Uses offset-based pagination. Any attribute in the full files or folders objects can be passed in with the fields parameter to get specific attributes, and only those specific attributes back; otherwise, the mini format is returned for each item by default. Multiple attributes can be passed in using the fields parameter. Paginated results can be retrieved using the limit and offset parameters.
member.param: The maximum number of items to return in a page. The default is 100 and the max is 1000.

The offset at which to begin the response. An offset of value of 0 will start at the beginning of the folder-listing. Note: If there are hidden items in your previous response, your next offset should be = offset + limit, not the # of records you received back. The default is 0.
Attribute(s) to include in the response
Whether or not to auto-paginate to fetch all items; defaults to false.
The field to sort items on
The direction to sort results in: ascending or descending
The shared link for this folder
The password for the shared link (if required)
member.returns: A collection of items contained in the folder is returned. An error is thrown if the folder does not exist, or if any of the parameters are invalid. The total_count returned may not match the number of entries when using enterprise scope, because external folders are hidden the list of entries.

member.name: M:Box.V2.Managers.BoxMetadataManager.UpdateFileMetadataAsync(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{Box.V2.Models.BoxMetadataUpdate},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Used to update the template instance. The request body must follow the JSON-Patch specification, which is represented as a JSON array of operation objects (see examples for more details). Updates can be either add, replace, remove , test, move, or copy. The template instance can only be updated if the template instance already exists. When editing metadata, only values that adhere to the metadata template schema will be accepted. The update is applied atomically. If any errors occur during the application of the update operations, the metadata instance remains unchanged.
member.param: Id of file
Metadata updates to apply
Scope name. Currently, the only scopes support are enterprise and global
Metadata template name
member.returns: A Dictionary of key:value pairs representing the metadata.

member.summary: The manager that represents the search endpoint
Search for items that are accessible by a single user or an entire enterprise.
member.param: The string to search for. Box matches the search string against object names, descriptions, text contents of files, and other data.

The scope for which you want to limit your search to. Can be user_content for a search limited to only the current user or enterprise_content for the entire enterprise. To enable the enterprise_content scope for an administrator, please contact Box.
Limit searches to specific file extension(s).
The from date for when the item was created
The to date for when the item was created
The from date for when the item was last updated
The to date for when the item was last updated
The lower bound of the file size range in bytes
The upper bound of the file size range in bytes
Search by item owners
Limit searches to specific parent folders
Limit searches to specific Box designated content types. Can be name, description, file_content, comments, or tags.
The type you want to return in your search. Can be file, folder, or web_link
Allows you to search within the trash. Can be trashed_only or non_trashed_only. Searches without this parameter default to non_trashed_only

Filters for a specific metadata template for files with metadata object associations. NOTE: For searches with the mdfilters param, a query string is not required. Currenly only one BoxMetadataFilterRequest element is allowed.
Number of search results to return. The default is 30 and the maximum is 200.
The search result at which to start the response. The default is 0.

The direction to return the results. "ASC" for ascending and "DESC" for descending.

The Box service object
The box converter object to use
The auth repository object to use
The user ID to set as the 'As-User' header parameter; used to make calls in the context of a user using an admin token

Whether or not to suppress both email and webhook notifications. Typically used for administrative API calls. Your application must have “Manage an Enterprise” scope, and the user making the API calls is a co-admin with the correct "Edit settings for your company" permission.

member.name: M:Box.V2.Managers.BoxSharedItemsManager.SharedItemsAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Shared items are any files or folders that are represented by a shared link. Shared items are different from other API resources in that a shared resource doesn’t necessarily have to be in the account of the user accessing it. The actual shared link itself is used along with a normal access token.
member.param: The shared link for this item.
The password for the shared link (if required)
member.returns: A full file or folder object is returned if the shared link is valid and the user has access to it. An error may be returned if the link is invalid, if a password is required, or if the user does not have access to the file.

member.name: M:Box.V2.Managers.BoxUsersManager.MoveUserFolderAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Moves all of the owned content from within one user’s folder into a new folder in another user’s account. You can move folders across users as long as the you have administrative permissions and the ‘source’ user owns the folders. To move everything from the root folder, use “0” which always represents the root folder of a Box account.
member.param: Id of the user.
The ID of the user who the folder will be transferred to.
Currently only moving of the root folder (0) is supported.
Determines if the destination user should receive email notification of the transfer.
Optional timeout for response.
member.returns: Returns the information for the newly created destination folder. An error is thrown if you do not have the necessary permissions to move the folder.

member.name: M:Box.V2.Managers.BoxWebhooksManager.VerifyWebhook(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
Used to validate an incoming webhook by computing cryptographic digests of the notification's payload and comparing them to the digests computed by Box and placed in the BOX-SIGNATURE-PRIMARY and BOX-SIGNATURE-SECONDARY request headers.
For more information about validating webhooks see
member.param: Value in BOX-DELIVERY-TIMESTAMP header.
Value in BOX-SIGNATURE-PRIMARY header.
Value in BOX-SIGNATURE-SECONDARY header.
Body of the incoming webhook request.
Primary webhook signature key.
Secondary webhook signature key.
member.returns: Returns true if at least one of the two webhook signatures match the computed signature.

member.param: BoxCollaborationRequest object.
Attribute(s) to include in the response.
member.returns: The updated collaboration object is returned. If the role is changed to owner, the collaboration is deleted with a new one created for the previous owner and a 204 is returned. Errors may occur if the IDs are invalid or if the user does not have permissions to edit the collaboration.

Events to filter by.
A lower bound on the timestamp of the events returned.
An upper bound on the timestamp of the events returned.

member.param: Limits the number of events returned (defaults to 500).

Restricts the types of events returned: all returns all events; changes returns events that may cause file tree changes such as file updates or collaborations; sync returns events that may cause file tree changes only for synced folders.
The location in the event stream from which you want to start receiving events. You can specify the special value 'now' to get 0 events and the latest stream_position value. Defaults to 'now'.
Whether or not to automatically de-duplicate events as they are received. Defaults to true.

Whether or not to automatically de-duplicate events as they are received. Defaults to true.
Used to override the retry timeout value returned from the long polling OPTIONS request.

member.summary: This method is used to upload a new version of an existing file in a user’s account. Similar to regular file uploads, these are performed as multipart form uploads. An optional If-Match header can be included to ensure that client only overwrites the file if it knows about the latest version. The filename on Box will remain the same as the previous version. To update the file’s name, you can specify a new name for the file using the fileName parameter. A proper timeout should be provided for large uploads.

png or jpg with no "."

member.name: M:Box.V2.Managers.IBoxFilesManager.PromoteVersionAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: If there are previous versions of this file, this method can be used to promote one of the older versions to the top of the stack. This actually mints a copy of the old version and puts it on the top of the versions stack. The file will have the exact same contents, the same SHA1/etag, and the same name as the promoted version. Other properties such as comments do not get updated to their former values.
member.param: Id of the file (Required).
Id of the version (Required).
member.returns: The newly promoted file_version object is returned

member.name: M:Box.V2.Managers.IBoxFoldersManager.GetFolderItemsAsync(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean,System.String,System.Nullable{Box.V2.Models.BoxSortDirection},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the files and/or folders contained within this folder without any other metadata about the folder. Any attribute in the full files or folders objects can be passed in with the fields parameter to get specific attributes, and only those specific attributes back; otherwise, the mini format is returned for each item by default. Multiple attributes can be passed in using the fields parameter. Paginated results can be retrieved using the limit and offset parameters.
member.param: The maximum number of items to return in a page. The default is 100 and the max is 1000.

The offset at which to begin the response. An offset of value of 0 will start at the beginning of the folder-listing. Note: If there are hidden items in your previous response, your next offset should be = offset + limit, not the # of records you received back. The default is 0.
Attribute(s) to include in the response
Whether or not to auto-paginate to fetch all items; defaults to false.
The field to sort items on
The direction to sort results in: ascending or descending
The shared link for this folder
The password for the shared link (if required)
member.returns: A collection of items contained in the folder is returned. An error is thrown if the folder does not exist, or if any of the parameters are invalid. The total_count returned may not match the number of entries when using enterprise scope, because external folders are hidden the list of entries.

member.name: M:Box.V2.Managers.IBoxFoldersManager.GetFolderItemsMarkerBasedAsync(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean,System.String,System.Nullable{Box.V2.Models.BoxSortDirection},System.String,System.String)

Multiple attributes can be passed in using the fields parameter. Paginated results can be retrieved using the limit and marker parameters.
member.param: The maximum number of items to return in a page. The default is 100 and the max is 1000.
Position to return results from..

Whether or not to auto-paginate to fetch all items; defaults to false.
The field to sort items on

member.name: M:Box.V2.Managers.IBoxMetadataManager.UpdateFileMetadataAsync(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{Box.V2.Models.BoxMetadataUpdate},System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Used to update the template instance. The request body must follow the JSON-Patch specification, which is represented as a JSON array of operation objects (see examples for more details). Updates can be either add, replace, remove , test, move, or copy. The template instance can only be updated if the template instance already exists. When editing metadata, only values that adhere to the metadata template schema will be accepted. The update is applied atomically. If any errors occur during the application of the update operations, the metadata instance remains unchanged.
member.param: Id of file
Metadata updates to apply
Scope name. Currently, the only scopes support are enterprise and global
Metadata template name
member.returns: A Dictionary of key:value pairs representing the metadata.

Metadata updates to apply
Scope name. Currently, only the enterprise scope is supported
Metadata template name
member.returns: A Dictionary of key:value pairs representing the metadata.

member.name: T:Box.V2.Managers.IBoxSearchManager
member.summary: The manager that represents the search endpoint
Search for items that are accessible by a single user or an entire enterprise.
member.param: The string to search for. Box matches the search string against object names, descriptions, text contents of files, and other data.

The scope for which you want to limit your search to. Can be user_content for a search limited to only the current user or enterprise_content for the entire enterprise. To enable the enterprise_content scope for an administrator, please contact Box.
Limit searches to specific file extension(s).
The from date for when the item was created
The to date for when the item was created
The from date for when the item was last updated
The to date for when the item was last updated
The lower bound of the file size range in bytes
The upper bound of the file size range in bytes
Search by item owners
Limit searches to specific parent folders
Limit searches to specific Box designated content types. Can be name, description, file_content, comments, or tags.
The type you want to return in your search. Can be file, folder, or web_link
Allows you to search within the trash. Can be trashed_only or non_trashed_only. Searches without this parameter default to non_trashed_only

Filters for a specific metadata template for files with metadata object associations. NOTE: For searches with the mdfilters param, a query string is not required. Currenly only one BoxMetadataFilterRequest element is allowed.
Number of search results to return. The default is 30 and the maximum is 200.
The search result at which to start the response. The default is 0.
Attribute(s) to include in the response.
The field to sort the search results by, e.g. "modified_at".
The direction to return the results. "ASC" for ascending and "DESC" for descending.
member.returns: A collection of search results is returned. If there are no matching search results, the collection will be empty.

member.name: T:Box.V2.Managers.IBoxSharedItemsManager
member.summary: Shared items are any files or folders that are represented by a shared link.

member.name: M:Box.V2.Managers.IBoxSharedItemsManager.SharedItemsAsync(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Shared items are any files or folders that are represented by a shared link. Shared items are different from other API resources in that a shared resource doesn’t necessarily have to be in the account of the user accessing it. The actual shared link itself is used along with a normal access token.
member.param: The shared link for this item.
The password for the shared link (if required)
member.returns: A full file or folder object is returned if the shared link is valid and the user has access to it. An error may be returned if the link is invalid, if a password is required, or if the user does not have access to the file.

member.returns: Null, if user is deleted.

member.name: M:Box.V2.Managers.IBoxUsersManager.InviteUserToEnterpriseAsync(Box.V2.Models.BoxUserInviteRequest,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Invites an existing user to join an Enterprise. The existing user cannot be part of another Enterprise and must already have a Box account. Once invited, the user will receive an email and prompt to accept the invitation within the Box web application. This method requires the "Manage An Enterprise" scope for the enterprise, which can be enabled within your developer console.
member.param: BoxUserInviteRequest object.
Attribute(s) to include in the response.
member.returns: A new invite object will be returned if successful.

member.name: M:Box.V2.Managers.IBoxUsersManager.MoveUserFolderAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan})
member.summary: Moves all of the owned content from within one user’s folder into a new folder in another user’s account. You can move folders across users as long as the you have administrative permissions and the ‘source’ user owns the folders. To move everything from the root folder, use “0” which always represents the root folder of a Box account.
member.param: Id of the user.
The ID of the user who the folder will be transferred to.
Currently only moving of the root folder (0) is supported.
Determines if the destination user should receive email notification of the transfer.
Optional timeout for response.
member.returns: Returns the information for the newly created destination folder. An error is thrown if you do not have the necessary permissions to move the folder.

The item at which to begin the response.
Default is 100. Max is 1000.
Whether or not to auto-paginate to fetch all group memberships; defaults to false.
member.returns: A collection of group membership objects will be returned upon success.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxMetadataUpdate.Op
member.summary: The operation type. Must be add, replace, remove , test, move, or copy.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxMetadataUpdate.Path
member.summary: The path that designates the key, in the format of a JSON-Pointer. Since all keys are located at the root of the metadata instance, the key must be prefixed with a /. Special characters ~ and / in the key must be escaped according to JSON-Pointer specification. The value at the path must exist for the operation to be successful.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxMetadataUpdate.Value
member.summary: The value to be set or tested. Required for add, replace, and test operations. For add, if value already exists, then previous value will be overwritten by the new value. For replace, the metadata value must exist before replacing.For test, the value of the existing metadata instance must match the specified value.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxMetadataUpdate.From
member.summary: Required for move or copy. The path that designates the source key, in the format of a JSON-Pointer, formatted in the same way as path. Used in conjunction with path: from specifies the source, path specifies the destination.

member.name: T:Box.V2.Models.BoxRetentionPolicy
member.summary: Box representation of a retention policy

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxRetentionPolicy.PolicyName
member.summary: The name given to the retention policy

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxRetentionPolicy.PolicyType
member.summary: The type of the retention policy. A retention policy type can either be finite, where a specific amount of time to retain the content is known upfront, or indefinite, where the amount of time to retain the content is still unknown.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxRetentionPolicy.RetentionLength
member.summary: The length of the retention policy. This length specifies the duration in days that the retention policy will be active for after being assigned to content.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxRetentionPolicy.DispositionAction
member.summary: The disposition action of the retention policy. This action can be permanently_delete, which will cause the content retained by the policy to be permanently deleted, or remove_retention, which will lift the retention policy from the content, allowing it to be deleted by users, once the retention policy time period has passed.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxRetentionPolicy.Status
member.summary: The status of a retention policy. The status of a policy will be active, unless explicitly retired by an administrator, in which case the status will be retired. Once a policy has been retired, it cannot become active again.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxRetentionPolicy.CreatedBy
member.summary: A mini user object representing the user that created the retention policy.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxRetentionPolicy.CreatedAt
member.summary: The time that the retention policy was created.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxRetentionPolicy.ModifiedAt
member.summary: The time that the retention policy was last modified.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxRetentionPolicy.CanOwnerExtendRetention
member.summary: Whether owners of items under the policy can extend the retention period.

member.summary: A standard representation of a sign request, as returned from any Box Sign API endpoints by default.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxSignRequest.AreRemindersEnabled
member.summary: Reminds signers to sign a document on day 3, 8, 13 and 18. Reminders are only sent to outstanding signers.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxSignRequest.AreTextSignaturesEnabled
member.summary: Disables the usage of signatures generated by typing (text).

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxSignRequest.AutoExpireAt
member.summary: Uses days_valid to calculate the date and time, in GMT, the sign request will expire if unsigned.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxSignRequest.DaysValid
member.summary: Number of days after which this request will automatically expire if not completed.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxSignRequest.EmailMessage
member.summary: Message to include in sign request email. The field is cleaned through sanitization of specific characters. However, some html tags are allowed. Links included in the message are also converted to hyperlinks in the email. The message may contain the following html tags including a, abbr, acronym, b, blockquote, code, em, i, ul, li, ol, and strong. Be aware that when the text to html ratio is too high, the email may end up in spam filters. Custom styles on these tags are not allowed. If this field is not passed, a default message will be used.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxSignRequest.EmailSubject
member.summary: Subject of sign request email.This is cleaned by sign request.If this field is not passed, a default subject will be used.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxSignRequest.ExternalId
member.summary: This can be used to reference an ID in an external system that the sign request is related to.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxSignRequest.IsDocumentPreparationNeeded
member.summary: Indicates if the sender should receive a prepare_url in the response to complete document preparation via UI.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxSignRequest.ParentFolder
member.summary: The destination folder to place final, signed document and signing log. Only ID and type fields are required. The root folder, folder ID 0, cannot be used.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxSignRequest.PrefillTags
member.summary: When a document contains sign related tags in the content, you can prefill them using this prefill_tags by referencing the 'id' of the tag as the external_id field of the prefill tag.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxSignRequest.PrepareUrl
member.summary: This URL is returned if is_document_preparation_needed is set to true in the request. It is used to prepare the sign request via UI. The sign request is not sent until preparation is complete.

member.summary: If set to true, signer will need to login to a Box account before signing the request. If the signer does not have an existing account, they will have an option to create a free Box account.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxSignRequestSigner.Password
member.summary: If set, the signer is required to enter the password before they are able to sign a document. This field is write only.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxSignRequestSigner.SignerGroupId
member.summary: If set, signers who have the same group ID will be assigned to the same input. A signer group is expected to have more than one signer. When a group contains fewer than two signers, it will be converted to a single signer and the group will be removed.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxSignTemplate.EmailMessage
member.summary: Message to include in signature request email. The field is cleaned through sanitization of specific characters. However, some html tags are allowed. Links included in the message are also converted to hyperlinks in the email. The message may contain the following html tags including a, abbr, acronym, b, blockquote, code, em, i, ul, li, ol, and strong. Be aware that when the text to html ratio is too high, the email may end up in spam filters. Custom styles on these tags are not allowed. If this field is not passed, a default message will be used.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxSignTemplate.ReadySignLink
member.summary: Box's ready-sign link feature enables you to create a link to a signature request that you've created from a template. Use this link when you want to post a signature request on a public form — such as an email, social media post, or web page — without knowing who the signers will be. Note: The ready-sign link feature is limited to Enterprise Plus customers and not available to Box Verified Enterprises.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.Request.BoxMetadataFilterRequest.Filters
member.summary: Child of mdfilters. Keys and values of the template you want to search within. For numbers and dates, you can include an (inclusive) upper bound parameter lt or (inclusive) lower bound parameter gt or both bounds. An example filter for a “contractExpiration” on or before 08-01-16 would be listed as {"contractExpiration":{"lt":"2016-08-01T00:00-00:00"}}

member.summary: finite or indefinite

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.Request.BoxRetentionPolicyRequest.RetentionLength
member.summary: The retention_length is the amount of time, in days, to apply the retention policy to the selected content in days. Do not specify for indefinite policies. Required for finite policies.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.Request.BoxRetentionPolicyRequest.DispositionAction
member.summary: If creating a finite policy, the disposition action can be permanently_delete or remove_retention. For indefinite policies, disposition action must be remove_retention.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.Request.BoxRetentionPolicyRequest.Status
member.summary: Used to retire a retention policy if status is set to retired. If not retiring a policy, do not include or set to null.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.Request.BoxRetentionPolicyRequest.CanOwnerExtendRetention
member.summary: Used to determine if the owner of items under the policy can extend the retention when the original period is ending.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.Request.BoxRetentionPolicyRequest.AreOwnersNotified
member.summary: Used to determine if owners and co-owners of items under the policy are notified when the retention period is ending.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.Request.BoxRetentionPolicyRequest.CustomNotificationRecipients
member.summary: List of additional users to notify when the retention period is ending.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.Request.BoxRetentionPolicyRequest.RetentionType
member.summary: Used to determine the type of retention policy, value can be modifiable or non-modifiable When updating a retention policy, you can use non-modifiable type only. You can convert a modifiable policy to non-modifiable, but not the other way around.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.Request.BoxRetentionPolicyRequest.Description

member.summary: Disables the usage of signatures generated by typing (text).

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.Request.BoxSignRequestCreateRequest.DaysValid
member.summary: Number of days after which this request will automatically expire if not completed.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.Request.BoxSignRequestCreateRequest.EmailMessage
member.summary: Message to include in sign request email. The field is cleaned through sanitization of specific characters. However, some html tags are allowed. Links included in the message are also converted to hyperlinks in the email. The message may contain the following html tags including a, abbr, acronym, b, blockquote, code, em, i, ul, li, ol, and strong. Be aware that when the text to html ratio is too high, the email may end up in spam filters. Custom styles on these tags are not allowed. If this field is not passed, a default message will be used.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.Request.BoxSignRequestCreateRequest.EmailSubject
member.summary: Subject of sign request email. This is cleaned by sign request. If this field is not passed, a default subject will be used.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.Request.BoxSignRequestCreateRequest.ExternalId
member.summary: This can be used to reference an ID in an external system that the sign request is related to.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.Request.BoxSignRequestCreateRequest.IsDocumentPreparationNeeded
member.summary: Indicates if the sender should receive a prepare_url in the response to complete document preparation via UI.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.Request.BoxSignRequestCreateRequest.ParentFolder
member.summary: The destination folder to place final, signed document and signing log. Only ID and type fields are required. The root folder, folder ID 0, cannot be used.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.Request.BoxSignRequestCreateRequest.PrefillTags

member.summary: Model used to send request to Box AI Ask API

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxAIAskRequest.Items
member.summary: The items to be processed by the LLM, often files. Note: Box AI handles documents with text representations up to 1MB in size, or a maximum of 25 files, whichever comes first. If the file size exceeds 1MB, the first 1MB of text representation will be processed. If you set mode parameter to single_item_qa, the items array can have one element only.

member.name: P:Box.V2.Models.BoxAIAskRequest.Mode
member.summary: The mode specifies if this request is for a single or multiple items.If you select single_item_qa the items array can have one element only. Selecting multiple_item_qa allows you to provide up to 25 items.

member.summary: The prompt provided by the client to be answered by the LLM.The prompt's length is limited to 10000 characters.
